Verses.68:
Blessed is the Lord, the God of Israel,[*]
	who has come to set his people free.
Verses.69:
He has raised up for us a mighty savior,[*]
	from the house of His servant David.
Verses.70: Through His holy prophets, long ago God promised, [t]
Verses.71:
to save us from our enemies, [*]
	and the hands of all who hate us.
Verses.72:
He promised to show mercy to our ancestors,[*]
	and to remember His holy covenant.
Verses.73: This was the oath God swore to our father Abraham,[t]
Verses.74:
to rescue us out of the hands of our enemies, [*]
	free to worship Him without fear,
Verses.75:
holy and righteous before Him,[*]
	all the days of our lives.
Verses.76:
And you, my child, will be called prophet of the Most High,[*]
	for you will go, before the Lord, preparing his ways,
Verses.77:
to give his people knowledge of salvation,[*]
	through the forgiveness of their sins.
Verses.78:
In the tender mercy of our God,[*]
	from high above the first light of day reaches us,
Verses.79:
shining on those who dwell in darkness and the shadow of death,[*]
	and guiding our feet into the way of peace.
